page.title: 12Farming
page.content: This area is predominately a dairy farming area,although because the government have given each farmer a milk qusta which they must not pass. Many small farmers have changed to beef cattle.There are many small farms,and 1 or 2 large ones.The smaller farms employ the more traditional methods of farming while the larger ones try new methods.Most of the animals are put out to eat grass in the summer except for D Denstone Hall where they are kept inside all the time and fed silage. There is only 1 farm in the area which keeps pigs,Greenacres.Two farms breed horses Quixhill and Calwich Cottage where the farmer has sold most of his land to Alton Towers but breeds Shetland ponies in his retirement.As farmers get to retiring age they sometimes change to beef because it is much easier work.
